video.title: Code 15 React Projects - Complete Course
video.description:
Improve your skills with the React JavaScript library by building 15 projects using React.

🔗 Code: https://github.com/john-smilga/react-projects

🔗 React Fundamentals Course: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4UZrsTqkcW4

✏️ Course from John Smilga of the Coding Addict channel. Check out his channel: https://www.youtube.com/codingaddict

topLevelComment.author: Jeyaraj Software
topLevelComment.text: Hello John, Amazing tutorial. Thanks for the great work! One issue I noticed in the 04-accordion project have one issue that it's fixed by applying this <AiOutlinePlus> contains a "pId" attribute out of the box which is deemed invalid by React and throws an error and plus button was not working. Since this is a problem related to the used third-party package itself (ref), I superseded react-icons/ai with react-icons/bs which doesn't throw any such error.

topLevelComment.author: Sneh
topLevelComment.text: I still do not understand how jobs[value] was undefined when moved above the loading condtional @2:06:30. Can someone help?

replies.author: Danko
replies.text: fetchJobs function makes an asynchronous request to the server via url, you cannot get the value jobs[value] because the asynchronous request hasn't finished yet. When the request is completed, we change the loading state to false and thereby skip the piece of code with if(loading). Be sure to read about asynchronous programming in javascript

replies.author: react stack
replies.text:
If you are practicing .. I advice to you create one react app then change all files inside the "src" and "public" folders according the project.. when you finish one project cut the files and save them to separate folders (e.g Navbar, SideBar ,,,etc..) then add the files/folders of the new project ...PS don't forget to download the required libraries he used (e.g. react-cons, ,,,)
this will save the space , time and less processing in installing and running for every time
Or.....
If you look back to the fundamental react video for John(links up in the description)  you will note how he divided every project to a folder and by invoking everyone any time separately to app js

In the submenu CSS of stripe

Can someone please answer this question for me

replies.author: Здравко Христов
replies.text: When you set the top value of a absolute positioned element to 50%, its top is in the middle, not the center. That's why we need to move it upwards by half of its height. Here it comes - the transition property where 50% means 50% of the height of the element. It's the same with the left value.

replies.author: Ruchi Ray
replies.text:
It is not necessary to use react bootstrap, you can write your own CSS for making the website responsive.

Disadvantages- design can get monotonous, if you want to get really creative with the design, use your own css

replies.author: marrrrrk33
replies.text: @pyroghost11 while I agree with you that it is better to figure things out on your own, this isn’t always the most optimal solution for somebody who has absolutely no grounding in the particular technology. I think there are a ton of things that can be learned from these videos from the perspective of how React works and general work flow. I find a good approach is to try and pause the video and see if you can implement a feature or just going back and doing it on your own after watching it. But to figure out how to do all of theirs from scratch without a solid foundation in React would take a very long time IMO and not everybody has this much time. Many people are watching these vids after their work day and trying to learn how to code in what ever spare time they can find in their busy lives.
